entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 1.1 a-b** *कुन्तीपुत्रेषु जातेषु धृतराष्ट्रात्मजेषु च | मद्रराजसुता पाण्डुं रहो वचनमब्रवीत् ||१||*
Who did the daughter of the Madra king address?
A) Yudhiṣṭhira B) Bhīma C) Pandu D) Kṛṣṇa
entry.answer: C) Pandu • The verse states "Pandu" as the one addressed by Madra's daughter. • Yudhiṣṭhira and Bhīma are not mentioned in this context. • Kṛṣṇa is not present in this scene.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 2.2 a-b** *न मेऽस्ति त्वयि सन्तापो विगुणेऽपि परन्तप | नावरत्वे वरार्हायाः स्थित्वा चानघ नित्यदा ||२||*
Who is referred to as "Pārthā" (the son of Prithā) in this verse?
A) Arjuna B) Bhīma C) Yudhiṣṭhira D) Kṛṣṇa
entry.answer: A) Arjuna • "Pārthā" is a name of Arjuna, derived from his mother Prithā. • Bhīma and Yudhiṣṭhira are not called "Pārthā." • Kṛṣṇa is not referred to as "Pārthā."

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 4.4 a-b** *गान्धार्याश्चैव नृपते जातं पुत्रशतं तथा | श्रुत्वा न मे तथा दुःखमभवत्कुरुनन्दन ||३||*
What is the name of the king who had a hundred sons?
A) Dhṛtarāṣṭra B) Kṛṣṇa C) Yudhiṣṭhira D) Bhīma
entry.answer: A) Dhṛtarāṣṭra • The verse mentions "Gāndhāryā" (Gandhari) and her hundred sons. • Kṛṣṇa and Yudhiṣṭhira are not associated with this lineage. • Bhīma is a son of Kuntī, not Gandhari.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 5.5 a-b** *यदि त्वपत्यसन्तानं कुन्तिराजसुता मयि | कुर्यादनुग्रहो मे स्वयमेनां प्रचोदय ||५||*
Who is the "daughter of the king" (kuntirājā) in this verse?
A) Kuntī B) Gandhārī C) Madrī D) Draupadī
entry.answer: A) Kuntī • "Kuntirājā" refers to Kuntī, the mother of the Pāṇḍavas. • Gandhārī is the wife of Dhṛtarāṣṭra. • Madrī and Draupadī are not called "kuntirājā."

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 7.7 a-b** *ममाप्येष सदा माद्रि हृद्यर्थः परिवर्तते | न तु त्वां प्रसहे वक्तुमिष्टानिष्टविवक्षया ||७||*
Who is the speaker of this verse?
A) Kuntī B) Madrī C) Gandhārī D) Draupadī
entry.answer: B) Madrī • The verse is spoken by Madrī, as indicated by "mādri" (Madrī). • Kuntī and Gandhārī are not the speakers here. • Draupadī is not mentioned in this context.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 10.10 a-b** *मम चापिण्डनाशाय पूर्वेषामपि चात्मनः | मत्प्रियार्थं च कल्याणि कुरु कल्याणमुत्तमम् ||१०||*
Who is the speaker of this verse?
A) Kuntī B) Madrī C) Dhṛtarāṣṭra D) Bhīma
entry.answer: C) Dhṛtarāṣṭra • The verse is addressed to Dhṛtarāṣṭra, as "mam" (my) and "māt" (my) indicate. • Kuntī and Madrī are not the speakers. • Bhīma is not mentioned in this context.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 14.14 a-b** *सा त्वं माद्रीं प्लवेनेव तारयेमामनिन्दिते | अपत्यसंविभागेन परां कीर्तिमवाप्नुहि ||१४||*
Who is the one who "saves" Madrī?
A) Yudhiṣṭhira B) Bhīma C) Arjuna D) Kṛṣṇa
entry.answer: A) Yudhiṣṭhira • The verse refers to Yudhiṣṭhira as the one who saves Madrī. • Bhīma and Arjuna are not mentioned in this context. • Kṛṣṇa is not the savior here.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 20.20 a-b** *ज्येष्ठं युधिष्ठिरेत्याहुर्भीमसेनेति मध्यमम् | अर्जुनेति तृतीयं च कुन्तीपुत्रानकल्पयन् ||२०||*
Who is referred to as "the middle one" (mādhyamam)?
A) Bhīma B) Arjuna C) Yudhiṣṭhira D) Kṛṣṇa
entry.answer: A) Bhīma • "Mādhyamam" (middle) refers to Bhīma, the second son of Kuntī. • Arjuna is the third, and Yudhiṣṭhira is the first. • Kṛṣṇa is not a son of Kuntī.

What term describes the Pāṇḍavas as "born of gods"?
A) Devadatta B) Mahābala C) Kuruvaṃśa D) Kṛṣṇa
